elements.title: Olivetti Valentine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ettore Sottsass's design of the Olivetti Valentine typewriter (example pictured) was inspired by the pop-art nudes of Tom Wesselmann?

elements.title: the first game in Georgetown football history (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first game in Georgetown football history was never played?

elements.title: Family 1 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Family 1, a closely related group of Greek New Testament manuscripts, place the passage of the woman caught in adultery at the end of the Gospel of John as a separate story?

elements.title: Canada Centre Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Canada Centre Building has one of the first aquifer thermal energy storage systems?

elements.title: Spring Lake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Spring Lake has suffered from an infestation of Eurasian water milfoil, a noxious weed?

elements.title: Umrao Singh Sher-Gil (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Indian aristocrat and photographer Umrao Singh Sher-Gil left more than 3000 prints and negatives, including many of his daughter Amrita Sher-Gil, documenting life in Europe and India?

elements.title: Yes, And? (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Variety critic suggested that the title of Ariana Grande's "Yes, And?" followed on from that of "Thank U, Next"?

elements.title: medicalisation of sexuality (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as a result of the medicalisation of sexuality, sexual disorders like erectile dysfunction have been used as a "penile health gauge" to measure general wellbeing?
